summary: Walter Lloyd was an individual working in the Office of General Counsel at the CIA. The documents indicate his involvement in handling Privacy Act cases, specifically case 71-728 concerning Werbell. One document mentions a speed letter from A. F. Addona to Walter Lloyd regarding the estimated completion date for the Werbell case. Another document is a routing slip, suggesting Lloyd was part of the internal CIA document handling process. The documents suggest that Lloyd's role was primarily administrative and legal, dealing with privacy and legal matters within the CIA.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Walter Lloyd's significance in the JFK assassination context is not directly apparent. His involvement seems to be related to legal and administrative matters within the CIA, specifically concerning Privacy Act cases and document handling. There is no direct indication of his involvement in the JFK assassination in these documents.
